elem.8.26.enunciation: > Similar plane numbers have to one another the ratio which a square number has to a square number.

proof.text: Let > A, > B be similar plane numbers; I say that > A has to > B the ratio which a square number has to a square number.
For, since > A, > B are similar plane numbers, therefore one mean proportional number falls between > A, > B. [elem.8.18]

Let it so fall, and let it be > C; and let > D, > E, > F, the least numbers of those which have the same ratio with > A, > C, > B, be taken; [elem.7.33 or elem.8.2] therefore the extremes of them > D, > F are square. [elem.8.2.p.1]
And since, as > D is to > F, so is > A to > B, and > D, > F are square, therefore > A has to > B the ratio which a square number has to a square number. Q. E. D.
